Racist incident-
+
===Racist incident===
  +
The town received national press coverage on [[11 October]] [[2007]], after three white 16-year-old students allegedly yelled racial slurs and threw paper wads at minority students outside the 1,600-student Warwick High School. School officials vowed to discipline the three students with suspension or expulsion, tighten security, and ban Confederate flags on school property, and six of the students were charged with [[disorderly conduct]].<ref name=racism1>[http://local.lancasteronline.com/4/210712 Six at Warwick charged in wake of racial unrest in district]</ref>
  +
The superintendent said the incident was revealed only after a teacher overheard other students discussing it and alerted administrators.<ref name=racism>[http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20071011/ap_on_re_us/high_school_racism_2;_ylt=Arp73lIb6wAejJnYeKv2vetsaMYA Racist incident roils Pa. high school]</ref>
â
warwick doesnt like blacks.
+
In order to "[try] to rebound from a string of racially motivated incidents," the community will commemorate the 2009 [[Martin Luther King Jr. Day]] holiday with a call to unity. The community's churches, including the Lititz [[Moravian Church]], will make "a clear statement against racism." The Moravian Church's associate pastor, Mark Breland, who is the first [[African American]] to hold that position in the church, will deliver the message. Most of Lititz's congregations don't have African Americans, and community leaders felt that "part of learning to celebrate our diversity begins with hearing about the experience of diversity."<ref name=lol343>[http://articles.lancasteronline.com/local/4/232656 MLK Day service aims to help Lititz heal]</ref>
